playbook_text:
ACE Playbook Insights
Use these distilled reminders to plan tool usage. Keep tool calls faithful to the functions provided in the BFCL benchmark.

message_api
- delta1: When messaging about travel bookings, ensure message content reflects exact API state, not cached details.

inference_input.message:
[{'role': 'system', 'content': '[ACE_PLAYBOOK]
ACE Playbook Insights
Use these distilled reminders to plan tool usage. Keep tool calls faithful to the functions provided in the BFCL benchmark.

message_api
- delta1: When messaging about travel bookings, ensure message content reflects exact API state, not cached details.'}, {'role': 'user', 'content': "First cd within the 'ResearchDocs' directory and then locate any files titled 'report.csv'."}, {'role': 'assistant', 'content': "I'll help you navigate to the ResearchDocs directory and locate files titled 'report.csv'. Let me start by changing to the ResearchDocs directory.", 'tool_calls': [{'id': 'call_00_vD0YtW5wb2CSzyfDqlU2QZfI', 'type': 'function', 'function': {'name': 'cd', 'arguments': '{"folder": "ResearchDocs"}'}}]}, {'role': 'tool', 'content': '{"current_working_directory": "ResearchDocs"}', 'tool_call_id': 'call_00_vD0YtW5wb2CSzyfDqlU2QZfI'}, {'role': 'assistant', 'content': "Now I'll search for files titled 'report.csv' in the ResearchDocs directory and its subdirectories.", 'tool_calls': [{'id': 'call_00_qpZ4QPy9HIYlf9mfNGi7dB9D', 'type': 'function', 'function': {'name': 'find', 'arguments': '{"path": ".", "name": "report.csv"}'}}]}, {'role': 'tool', 'content': '{"matches": ["./report.csv"]}', 'tool_call_id': 'call_00_qpZ4QPy9HIYlf9mfNGi7dB9D'}, ChatCompletionMessage(content="Great! I found a file named 'report.csv' in the ResearchDocs directory. The file is located at `./report.csv` (in the current ResearchDocs directory).", refusal=None, role='assistant', annotations=None, audio=None, function_call=None, tool_calls=None), {'role': 'user', 'content': "Once you locate 'report.csv' in the 'ResearchDocs' directory, delve into it to find lines that reference the 'Quarterly Financial Overview'."}, {'role': 'assistant', 'content': "I'll search for lines in the 'report.csv' file that reference 'Quarterly Financial Overview'. Let me use grep to find those specific lines.", 'tool_calls': [{'id': 'call_00_CIMknstXYyIr4li1bj7XAbel', 'type': 'function', 'function': {'name': 'grep', 'arguments': '{"file_name": "report.csv", "pattern": "Quarterly Financial Overview"}'}}]}, {'role': 'tool', 'content': '{"matching_lines": ["Line 1: Introduction Line 2: Quarterly Financial Overview Line 3: Details Line 4: More Details Line 5: Quarterly Financial Overview Line 6: Conclusion Line 7: Quarterly Financial Overview Line 8: Quarter has been successful. Line 9: Quarterly Financial Overview Line 10: Final Thoughts"]}', 'tool_call_id': 'call_00_CIMknstXYyIr4li1bj7XAbel'}, ChatCompletionMessage(content="I found several lines in the 'report.csv' file that reference 'Quarterly Financial Overview'. Here are the matching lines:

- Line 1: Introduction Line 2: Quarterly Financial Overview Line 3: Details Line 4: More Details Line 5: Quarterly Financial Overview Line 6: Conclusion Line 7: Quarterly Financial Overview Line 8: Quarter has been successful. Line 9: Quarterly Financial Overview Line 10: Final Thoughts

The phrase 'Quarterly Financial Overview' appears multiple times throughout the file, specifically on lines 2, 5, 7, and 9.", refusal=None, role='assistant', annotations=None, audio=None, function_call=None, tool_calls=None), {'role': 'user', 'content': "Extract and display the last five lines from the 'report.csv' file in the 'ResearchDocs' directory, as these need to be emphasized for recent updates."}]

function.name: add_contact
function.description: This tool belongs to the Message API, which is used to manage user interactions in a workspace. Tool description: Add a contact to the workspace. Note that the provided function is in Python 3 syntax.

user_name.description: User name of contact to be added.

added_status.description: True if the contact was added successfully, False otherwise.

user_id.description: User ID of the added contact.

message.description: A message describing the result of the addition attempt.

function.name: delete_message
function.description: This tool belongs to the Message API, which is used to manage user interactions in a workspace. Tool description: Delete the latest message sent to a receiver. Note that the provided function is in Python 3 syntax.

receiver_id.description: User ID of the user to send the message to.

deleted_status.description: True if the message was deleted successfully, False otherwise.

receiver_id.description: ID of the receiver of the deleted message.

message.description: A message describing the result of the deletion attempt.

function.name: get_message_stats
function.description: This tool belongs to the Message API, which is used to manage user interactions in a workspace. Tool description: Get statistics about messages for the current user. Note that the provided function is in Python 3 syntax.

received_count.description: Number of messages received by the current user.

total_contacts.description: Total number of contacts the user has interacted with.

function.name: get_user_id
function.description: This tool belongs to the Message API, which is used to manage user interactions in a workspace. Tool description: Get user ID from user name. Note that the provided function is in Python 3 syntax.

function.name: list_users
function.description: This tool belongs to the Message API, which is used to manage user interactions in a workspace. Tool description: List all users in the workspace. Note that the provided function is in Python 3 syntax.

user_list.description: List of all users in the workspace.

function.name: message_get_login_status
function.description: This tool belongs to the Message API, which is used to manage user interactions in a workspace. Tool description: Get the login status of the current user. Note that the provided function is in Python 3 syntax.

login_status.description: True if the current user is logged in, False otherwise.

function.name: message_login
function.description: This tool belongs to the Message API, which is used to manage user interactions in a workspace. Tool description: Log in a user with the given user ID to messeage application. Note that the provided function is in Python 3 syntax.

user_id.description: User ID of the user to log in.

login_status.description: True if login was successful, False otherwise.

message.description: A message describing the result of the login attempt.

function.name: search_messages
function.description: This tool belongs to the Message API, which is used to manage user interactions in a workspace. Tool description: Search for messages containing a specific keyword. Note that the provided function is in Python 3 syntax.

keyword.description: The keyword to search for in messages.

results.description: List of dictionaries containing matching messages.

receiver_id.description: User ID of the receiver of the message.

function.name: send_message
function.description: This tool belongs to the Message API, which is used to manage user interactions in a workspace. Tool description: Send a message to a user. Note that the provided function is in Python 3 syntax.

receiver_id.description: User ID of the user to send the message to.

sent_status.description: True if the message was sent successfully, False otherwise.

message.description: A message describing the result of the send attempt.

function.name: view_messages_sent
function.description: This tool belongs to the Message API, which is used to manage user interactions in a workspace. Tool description: View all historical messages sent by the current user. Note that the provided function is in Python 3 syntax.

messages.description: Dictionary of messages grouped by receiver An example of the messages dictionary is {"USR001":["Hello"],"USR002":["World"]}.

function.name: cat
function.description: This tool belongs to the Gorilla file system. It is a simple file system that allows users to perform basic file operations such as navigating directories, creating files and directories, reading and writing to files, etc. Tool description: Display the contents of a file of any extension from currrent directory. Note that the provided function is in Python 3 syntax.

file_name.description: The name of the file from current directory to display. No path is allowed.

function.name: cd
function.description: This tool belongs to the Gorilla file system. It is a simple file system that allows users to perform basic file operations such as navigating directories, creating files and directories, reading and writing to files, etc. Tool description: Change the current working directory to the specified folder. Note that the provided function is in Python 3 syntax.

folder.description: The folder of the directory to change to. You can only change one folder level at a time.

current_working_directory.description: The new current working directory path.

function.name: cp
function.description: This tool belongs to the Gorilla file system. It is a simple file system that allows users to perform basic file operations such as navigating directories, creating files and directories, reading and writing to files, etc. Tool description: Copy a file or directory from one location to another.  If the destination is a directory, the source file or directory will be copied into the destination directory.  Both source and destination must be local to the current directory. Note that the provided function is in Python 3 syntax.

source.description: The name of the file or directory to copy.

destination.description: The destination name to copy the file or directory to. If the destination is a directory, the source will be copied into this directory. No file paths allowed.

result.description: The result of the copy operation or an error message if the operation fails.

function.name: diff
function.description: This tool belongs to the Gorilla file system. It is a simple file system that allows users to perform basic file operations such as navigating directories, creating files and directories, reading and writing to files, etc. Tool description: Compare two files of any extension line by line at the current directory. Note that the provided function is in Python 3 syntax.

file_name1.description: The name of the first file in current directory.

file_name2.description: The name of the second file in current directory.

diff_lines.description: The differences between the two files.

function.name: du
function.description: This tool belongs to the Gorilla file system. It is a simple file system that allows users to perform basic file operations such as navigating directories, creating files and directories, reading and writing to files, etc. Tool description: Estimate the disk usage of a directory and its contents. Note that the provided function is in Python 3 syntax.

human_readable.description: If True, returns the size in human-readable format (e.g., KB, MB).

function.name: echo
function.description: This tool belongs to the Gorilla file system. It is a simple file system that allows users to perform basic file operations such as navigating directories, creating files and directories, reading and writing to files, etc. Tool description: Write content to a file at current directory or display it in the terminal. Note that the provided function is in Python 3 syntax.

content.description: The content to write or display.

file_name.description: The name of the file at current directory to write the content to. Defaults to None.

terminal_output.description: The content if no file name is provided, or None if written to file.

function.name: find
function.description: This tool belongs to the Gorilla file system. It is a simple file system that allows users to perform basic file operations such as navigating directories, creating files and directories, reading and writing to files, etc. Tool description: Find any file or directories under specific path that contain name in its file name.  This method searches for files of any extension and directories within a specified path that match the given name. If no name is provided, it returns all files and directories in the specified path and its subdirectories. Note: This method performs a recursive search through all subdirectories of the given path. Note that the provided function is in Python 3 syntax.

path.description: The directory path to start the search. Defaults to the current directory (".").

name.description: The name of the file or directory to search for. If None, all items are returned.

matches.description: A list of matching file and directory paths relative to the given path.

function.name: grep
function.description: This tool belongs to the Gorilla file system. It is a simple file system that allows users to perform basic file operations such as navigating directories, creating files and directories, reading and writing to files, etc. Tool description: Search for lines in a file of any extension at current directory that contain the specified pattern. Note that the provided function is in Python 3 syntax.

file_name.description: The name of the file to search. No path is allowed and you can only perform on file at local directory.

function.name: ls
function.description: This tool belongs to the Gorilla file system. It is a simple file system that allows users to perform basic file operations such as navigating directories, creating files and directories, reading and writing to files, etc. Tool description: List the contents of the current directory. Note that the provided function is in Python 3 syntax.

a.description: Show hidden files and directories. Defaults to False.

current_directory_content.description: A list of the contents of the specified directory.

function.name: mkdir
function.description: This tool belongs to the Gorilla file system. It is a simple file system that allows users to perform basic file operations such as navigating directories, creating files and directories, reading and writing to files, etc. Tool description: Create a new directory in the current directory. Note that the provided function is in Python 3 syntax.

dir_name.description: The name of the new directory at current directory. You can only create directory at current directory.

function.name: mv
function.description: This tool belongs to the Gorilla file system. It is a simple file system that allows users to perform basic file operations such as navigating directories, creating files and directories, reading and writing to files, etc. Tool description: Move a file or directory from one location to another. Note that the provided function is in Python 3 syntax.

source.description: Source name of the file or directory to move. Source must be local to the current directory.

destination.description: The destination name to move the file or directory to. Destination must be local to the current directory and cannot be a path. If destination is not an existing directory like when renaming something, destination is the new file name.

result.description: The result of the move operation.

function.name: pwd
function.description: This tool belongs to the Gorilla file system. It is a simple file system that allows users to perform basic file operations such as navigating directories, creating files and directories, reading and writing to files, etc. Tool description: Return the current working directory path. Note that the provided function is in Python 3 syntax.

function.name: rm
function.description: This tool belongs to the Gorilla file system. It is a simple file system that allows users to perform basic file operations such as navigating directories, creating files and directories, reading and writing to files, etc. Tool description: Remove a file or directory. Note that the provided function is in Python 3 syntax.

file_name.description: The name of the file or directory to remove.

result.description: The result of the remove operation.

function.name: rmdir
function.description: This tool belongs to the Gorilla file system. It is a simple file system that allows users to perform basic file operations such as navigating directories, creating files and directories, reading and writing to files, etc. Tool description: Remove a directory at current directory. Note that the provided function is in Python 3 syntax.

dir_name.description: The name of the directory to remove. Directory must be local to the current directory.

result.description: The result of the remove operation.

function.name: sort
function.description: This tool belongs to the Gorilla file system. It is a simple file system that allows users to perform basic file operations such as navigating directories, creating files and directories, reading and writing to files, etc. Tool description: Sort the contents of a file line by line. Note that the provided function is in Python 3 syntax.

file_name.description: The name of the file appeared at current directory to sort.

sorted_content.description: The sorted content of the file.

function.name: tail
function.description: This tool belongs to the Gorilla file system. It is a simple file system that allows users to perform basic file operations such as navigating directories, creating files and directories, reading and writing to files, etc. Tool description: Display the last part of a file of any extension. Note that the provided function is in Python 3 syntax.

file_name.description: The name of the file to display. No path is allowed and you can only perform on file at local directory.

lines.description: The number of lines to display from the end of the file. Defaults to 10.

last_lines.description: The last part of the file.

function.name: touch
function.description: This tool belongs to the Gorilla file system. It is a simple file system that allows users to perform basic file operations such as navigating directories, creating files and directories, reading and writing to files, etc. Tool description: Create a new file of any extension in the current directory. Note that the provided function is in Python 3 syntax.

file_name.description: The name of the new file in the current directory. file_name is local to the current directory and does not allow path.

function.name: wc
function.description: This tool belongs to the Gorilla file system. It is a simple file system that allows users to perform basic file operations such as navigating directories, creating files and directories, reading and writing to files, etc. Tool description: Count the number of lines, words, and characters in a file of any extension from current directory. Note that the provided function is in Python 3 syntax.

file_name.description: Name of the file of current directory to perform wc operation on.

mode.description: Mode of operation ('l' for lines, 'w' for words, 'c' for characters).

count.description: The count of the number of lines, words, or characters in the file.

type.description: The type of unit we are counting. [Enum]: ["lines", "words", "characters"]
